Let's fix what's broken with elections

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Early voting for Georgia's runoff elections – including the important race for secretary of state – starts today! Election Day for runoffs is Tuesday, December 4.

Whoever becomes our next secretary of state will hold the role of chief elections officer and possess tremendous power to fix what is broken in our voting system. They will have the power to protect our sacred, constitutional right to vote by:

  • Ensuring that all counties have reliable and accurate voting equipment;
  • Opening convenient, accessible polling locations for every voter;
  • Encouraging more people to register to vote; and
  • Providing resources to shorten voting lines.

Early voting has already started in most counties and will continue through Friday, November 30. Check if your county participates in early voting.

Under the former secretary of state, 670,000 citizens were removed from the voter rolls last year. What kind of secretary of state will we choose on December 4? Visit our website to compare the candidates.

Help us get out the vote! RSVP to one of our phone banks on Tuesday, November 27, Wednesday, November 28, Saturday, December 1, or Monday, December 3!

Thanks for sticking with us,

Burrell Ellis
Political Director, ACLU of Georgia
